  • Possess and maintain all appropriate BAE safety and environmental certifications
  • Hook up and disconnect dock and ships temporary services in POSD/POCA
  • Assist Dockmaster in creating docking and undocking schedules for POSD/POCA
  • Attend docking and undocking conferences with Dockmaster
  • Assist Dockmaster in preparing ship for dry-docking and undocking
  • Work unsupervised on a daily basis trouble shooting and repairing mechanical, piping, and electrical systems

About BAE Systems Platforms & Services Posting: BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts - defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

The Platforms & Services (P&S) sector under BAE Systems, Inc does the big stuff: the armored combat vehicles, naval guns, missile launchers, and naval ship repair...just to name a few. Our employees take pride in the work they do and why they do it. They are on the front lines every day, building our products to protect the lives of those who serve. We may be biased, but we think P&S does some of the coolest work around, and we think you will too.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We're laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

Job Responsibilities/Duties Washington River Protection Solutions (WRPS) seeks a Software Engineer to join the Software Projects & Engineering Support group. The Engineer will support routine software & database maintenance activities, troubleshooting, modifications, procedure reviews, as defined in TFC-PLN-03 and as assigned by manager. The software products being developed and maintained are management information systems that are web-based, C# applications developed using the MVC or MVVM framework. Duties include development of software integration, design inputs and requirements, architecture and overall look and feel of productivity tools, software design, development, testing using current software, database technology and platform, also provide software quality assurance & maintenance support. Act as Technical Lead, guiding overall software design and direction of development to meet software requirements. May direct other engineers and junior engineers.

The Engineers responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following: * Accountable for safety based on the principals of no injuries to anyone; * Set challenging goals for personal and group accomplishments; * Set high standards of performance for self and others; * Develop and sustain productive customer relationships; * Ensure requirements meet software quality standards; * Perform software design, development, and testing; * Maintain cognizance of any changes to assigned software applications and database; * Review and approve new or changes to operating or maintenance procedures; * Review software applications, and establish testing requirements; * Perform software quality and configuration management activities; * Perform software and database operability evaluations, in support of daily activities; * Perform process software and database modification to include server application, system hardware and software development and testing; * Implement software configuration management program; * Implement process system computer security (as required); * Manage database configuration and coordinate creation of databases on development, test, and production servers; * Support manager in technical/technological decision-making; * Perform routine administrative activities/duties on time (routine training, safety meetings, TIS, continuing training, staff meetings); and * Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree (BS) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering or related technical discipline; and Five (5) years of related technical experience.

Desired Qualifications * Satisfactory knowledge of technical/professional skills in current development and trends, including MVC, MVVM, and Angular. * Must be familiar with server and network architecture including modification to software application/database and hardware/software development and testing systems. * Experience with GIS, BIS, or AR/VR is a plus.

Job Description:

   

Micro Focus is seeking a talented, strong, and motivated Software Engineer Intern to work on access governance and identity reporting software. We are looking for an individual with the right blend of skills, education, experience, and attitude to fill this position.

The successful candidate will have understanding and experience working with SQL. This individual will also demonstrate the ability to succeed with minimal supervision, and have the ability to think outside the box. This position will interact with other development, testing, and documentation teams to deliver software products.

The Work:

  • Work with software development, quality engineering, and documentation teams to design and implement features and capabilities
  • Create and execute test cases
  • Automation
  • Review and provide input for product documentation
  • Research and solve customer issues
  • Design and implement features and associated use cases using Agile methodologies

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
  • Programming experience in SQL and JavaScript
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently as well as on a team
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Possess a positive attitude and is a self-starter
  • Good problem solver, ability to identify key issues and barriers to success and to proactively resolve them
  • Ability to document technical processes
  • Detail oriented

  • Oracle
  • C#
  • Java
  • automation scripts
